intro: Barosma sertuliflora, commonly known as the coastal barosma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in coastal environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Barosma sertuliflora is well adapted to salt spray and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
